Vusamazulu Credo Mutwa (21 July 1921 – 25 March 2020) was a South African Zulu sangoma (traditional healer). He is known for writing books about African mythology, traditional Zulu folklore and extraterrestrial encounters. His works include "Indaba my Children" and "Tree of Life Trilogy". He was born in Natal.
Mutwa believed in using traditional African medicines for the treatment of AIDS, cancer and tuberculosis. He also agreed with David Icke's "reptilian" theory.
Mutwa died on 25 March 2020 at the age of 98.
